title: So Gangplank has a special taunt for Graves now
body:
_"Can't light cigars on the bottom of the sea."_
.
.
They should add,
.
.
_"....Or anywhere."_

replies.body:
From what I know the exposure of bones is considered Taboo in eastern regions (Don't remeber if in China, Japan both or other). By this Jurassic {{champion:31}} shouldn't be present all.

But Graves can't have a cigar.

> [{quoted}](name=Stars Shaper,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=4xtExdg9,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-08-06T10:12:22.152+0000)
>
> From what I know the exposure of bones is considered Taboo in eastern regions (Don't remeber if in China, Japan both or other). By this Jurassic {{champion:31}} shouldn't be present all.
> 
> But Graves can't have a cigar.

Human bones*
Pretty sure Cho ain't human
It's partly the reason they Re-did Karthus.
Kathus got a VU because in some places it's illegal to show *human* bones.
Or maybe he got a VU, because he looked like a pile of dung?
Porque no los dos?

A detail that may or may not be seen as offensive in a specific culture can't and won't ever be a main reason to do something like this.

Unless butthurt Hindu get mad about their topless goddess having clothes. (look Kali from Smite)

it was, because they did it when tencent bought out riot.

the content was then illegal for them produce so it had to be changed

China already had their own splash arts and models for Karthus.

They had to do nothing.

but it's now a chinese company producing it. they would then be breaking there laws by producing it when tencent purchased it.

doesn't matter that the splashes we not in china.
At least try to speak english, please.

Tencent, a company based in China, cannot produce images of human bones.

Riot game was purchased by Tencent.

images of human bones needed to be removed from the game, or else Tencent would be breaking the laws of the country they are based in.

the fact that what they produced was not visible in China does not make it socially or legally acceptable in Chinese culture.

>the fact that what they produced was not visible in China does not make it socially or legally acceptable in Chinese culture.

It does, since they have a different set of art that doesn't require any effort to maintain.

Hell, they still have a different set of splash arts for at least 80% of champions. You don't see Riot magically changing all splash arts because of that, but because their art is simply put crappy and of low quality.

okay... i'm going to try using an example for you.

if it is Illegal to sell handguns where I live, but legal for you to buy handguns where you live.

I still can't sell you a handgun from my hometown and ship it to you. I would still be breaking the law, even though, where I was selling the gun to it is a legal transaction.

Tencent is legally obligated not to have human bones in anything they own, produce, or make available.

They are still the contractually obligated owners of the content even though it's in North America, they still have to uphold the laws of the country they are based in.
Because not both?  I can't understand what you're saying.
Why not both
Trivia: Pentakill Karthus could have skull showing despite that. Most likely still does.
I think it's on his Mic maybe? otherwise No
http://img3.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20120107201859/leagueoflegends/images/2/27/Karthus_PentakillSkin_Ch.jpg

Human bones buddy.
Because burials are sacred.
Also it's illegal.

Cho is not a human, does not even somewhat apply to him.

Might kind of apply to spooky gangplank or zombie brand but otherwise I can't see anyone else having an issue.

Spooky GP is a Ghost, afaik no bones
 Zombie brand... I don't know if there's any Exposed bones or not, actually
And? THese regions deal with all of this in their way. So why does graves cigar have to be removed for EVERYONE?
Human bones and for this reason Karthus used to have a different model ingame and a different splash to hide his skull on the eastern servers.

Human Bones being openly displayed is seen as a great disrespect to those who came before you.  Many asian cultures revere their elders far above what western society does.  

However, animals don't fall in that category.  Reskinning Karthus keeps any form of incident from occurring in shipping the game over.
Jurassic Cho'Gath is another Evelynn skin in Asia.
Does it apply to Kog'maw too? xD
Skins are judged differently from the base models, therefore it doesn't matter.

Human bones, more so **Skulls**. Hence why {{champion:30}} was censored when he had a skull head:

http://img1.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20110215010404/leagueoflegends/images/2/24/Karthus_OriginalSkin_Ch.jpg

http://img4.wikia.nocookie.net/__cb20111202091028/leagueoflegends/images/9/97/Karthus_StatueOfSkin_Ch.jpg
GP can have oranges but Graves can't have a Cigar.

>
> GP can have oranges but Graves can't have a Cigar.

cause oranges are healthy

Cigars arent?

>
> cause oranges are healthy

Oranges are acid.
bottom of the sea... the sea is made of water... water makes a splash... can't have cigars in splash arts!
That's some serious illuminati shit right there, dude.
Why is this such a big discussion? I honestly don't get it. I didn't give a crap either way about his cigar, but TBH his splash looked better with it. but why is there such goings-on about it STILL?

The reason why Graves can't have a cigar _on his default skin_ is because in many cultures, not just eastern ones like China, smoking is seen as taboo.

But paid for skins are different.

Also yeah, the human bones and stuff is an issue for Asian (mainly Chinese) cultures.

>The reason why Graves can't have a cigar on his default skin is because in many cultures, not just eastern ones like China, smoking is seen as taboo.

Tell me about it.

>Smoking in China is prevalent, as China is the world's largest consumer and producer of tobacco.
[Yeah](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/x0VGeELE-new-gp-taunt-for-graves)...
ooooh i got an idea for a new "w" for graves... "graves throws his cigar to the ground silencing the enemies in an area by making them cough"
Metal gear solid skin?
